definition: to close down a business for good and put the best face on it (idiom)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]

sentences.english: In recent months, more than two dozen sub-prime lenders have closed their doors.
sentences.chinese: 近来数月，二十四家以上的低收入贷款公司关门大吉。

sentences.english: Two other plants in the town have also closed.
sentences.chinese: 而镇上的另外两个工厂也同时关门大吉。

sentences.english: How about staying around and helping me close up shop?
sentences.chinese: 围绕如何保持和帮助我关门大吉了？

sentences.english: Blair: That was disgusting. The d. o. h. Should shut them down.
sentences.chinese: 太恶心了，卫生部应该让他们关门大吉。

sentences.english: She plans to make use of him to exact her plan for revenge.
sentences.chinese: 品红决定利用大丰报复福喜，让万福楼关门大吉。

sentences.english: So did thousands of smaller stores.
sentences.chinese: 数以千计大大小小的唱片店也都关门大吉了。

definition: to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
to lose everything one invested (idiom)/to lose one's shirt
to open a business/first transaction of a business day
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
lit. drink the northwest wind (idiom); cold and hungry
